info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 5:01PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT RANDOLPH...CLEBURNE... NORTHEASTERN CLAY AND EASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM CST... At 501 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little River Falls to Abernathy to near Ashland. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lineville, Ashland, Cedar Bluff, Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Forney, Ranburne, Fruithurst, Edwardsville, Woodland, Gaylesville, Morrison Cross Roads, Barfield, Pleasant Gap, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake, Corinth, Muscadine, Abernathy, and Fosters Cross Roads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
